revised_title: Connection Between Null Field Method and Modified Green Functions
tldr: The article establishes a connection between the null field method and modified Green functions for solving Dirichlet and Neumann problems for the Helmholtz equation in an exterior domain. It shows that elements of the -matrix, formed by using appropriately chosen expansion functions, are precisely the coefficients of a representation of the Green function in terms of these same expansion functions. The linear independence of these functions and the invertibility of several infinite-dimensional matrices and their finite-dimensional approximations are crucial to the -matrix approach.
